item.title: How ICE and Border Patrol Keep Injuring and Killing People
item.description: After shooting people, federal agents repeatedly failed to provide first aid, and officials spun narratives disproven by video.

item.title: Amid ‘Catastrophic’ Shortage, Psychologists Flee Federal Prisons in Droves
item.description: With fewer and fewer employees to run the prisons, psychologists were repeatedly forced to act as guards.

item.title: How Trump Has Reshaped the Justice Department and Other Criminal Justice Areas in His Second Term
item.description: From immigration to the death penalty and beyond, here are some of the administration’s key changes in criminal justice.

item.title: Trump Threatened to Send Military Police to Minnesota. Here’s What They Can and Can’t Do.
item.description: Even during unrest, active-duty soldiers’ role in domestic law enforcement is limited, experts say.

item.title: Journalists: How to Include Family Perspectives in Prison Death Coverage
item.description: Family members’ experiences are key to understanding deaths in custody. These engagement tactics can unlock their untold stories.
